quotes.quote: The general who wins the battle makes many calculations.
quotes.application: No plan survives first contact, but it provides something to pivot from and adjust. This includes contingencies.

quotes.quote: He will win whose army is animated by the same spirit throughout all its ranks.
quotes.application: Keep your team informed of the how and the why. They should know, understand, and share the purpose and intent.

quotes.quote: A leader leads by example, not by force.
quotes.application: If you don't exemplify the standards you preach, subordinates will take them as recommendations instead of rules. You will likely lose respect and compliance.

quotes.quote: Know the enemy and know yourself; in a hundred battles you will never be defeated.
quotes.application: Problem framing is the basis of decision-making. Understanding your goal and your capabilities allows you to maximize chances of success.

quotes.quote: All warfare is based on deception.
quotes.application: Misdirection makes people who want to induce friction waste their resources while you use yours more economically. Concealment applies to both observation and intent.

quotes.quote: Knowledge of the enemyâ€™s dispositions can only be obtained from other men.
quotes.application: Make use of information-gathering assets at your disposal no matter how small the endeavor. Specifically, human intelligence can tell you why the adversary is doing something.

quotes.quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war.
quotes.application: Deliberate planning makes use of time and other resources available. Make planning for contingencies and business continuity a part of your deliberate planning so that those plans exist for rapid response.

quotes.quote: He who knows when he can fight and when he cannot, will be victorious.
quotes.application: Pick and choose your verbal and physical battles. Both require resources such as personnel and time.
